post.body: *sigh* What am I gonna do with you? :)
Glad he's doing better.
How darn cute is he? :)
I used to make them all...but that was back when I was crazy. ;)
We found ours last year, after Christmas. Made it easier this year. No decisions to be made. :)
Horrible. I guess I need to make more friends...and hire someone to do my cards for me.
I think I sent about 35-40 last year.
That sounds about right to me. I sent 51 this year, but that was more than usual. Lot's of younger cousins got their own addys.
Looks like you're way ahead of the game on Christmas baking. Great idea to make the dough ahead. Now you've got me thinking... :)
Aww Mr. B, you didn't need to take a quiz. We already knew there was no one like you. :)
No kidding. I'm usually this state's biggest fan. Today...I LOATHE it.
Best idea I've heard all day.
COMPLETELY ADORABLE BABY. How cute is he? So sweet.
Was going to respond to your baking comment, but then I clicked on your 12 seconds links & was completely distracted by your...
Sing it sistah!
*hands mike a steaming cup of tangerine orange with a big spoonful of honey*
Thanks. :) See you're not feeling so well. About to brew some tea and honey. Care for a cup?
Got your Christmas card, today. Of course, it made me cry. Love and miss you. :)
Why I oughtta...
I think Chicago temps will be enough punishment. Time to man up @DougE. ;)
heheh WOW. That's really awful. Truly. But, yes, that's what I'm talking about.
Okay. You're safe for now, but that neighbor of yours? Opening a can of kahwhoopas.
Okay. Tea is gone. Off to find the flanneliest of flannel jammies. Goodnight all.. :)
Wrapping myself around this cup of Elderberry tea and snuggling into bed. Goodnight all. :)
Quick survey: What do you think is a normal/average number of Christmas cards for a person/family to send out?
Getting the girls cozy & ready for bed. Getting myself into the warmest jammies I can find. Doing laundry. Brewing tea.
Back from final gym meet of the season. Ahhhh.
Church, lunch, cleaned up lunch mess. Fixed gymnast's hair. Leave for state meet in half an hour.
As fun as wrapping gifts is, it's 1:30 a.m. Probably best if I head to bed. Church followed by State Gymnastics Meet tomorrow. Goodnight all
Girls tucked in. Heading to the basement to wrap gifts.
Cooking all day. Almost time for the St. Lucia Feast.
Home from Christmas at Mom's. Everything was beautiful and yummy. Had a great time. So nice to be all together with people I love so much.
Church, then off to Christmas at Mom's "farm".
1:00 a.m. Cookie mess cleaned up. Dishwasher running. Laundry folded. Off to bed. Goodnight all.
Making Crunchy Clusters: chow mein noodles, almonds, butterscotch chips, sweetened condensed milk.
Watched The Nativity Story. Everyone should own that movie. So good. Girls tucked in. Laundry. Getting things done.
Girls sorting presents for Christmas at @Grama_Hen's tomorrow. Hooray! Can't wait. :)
Home from Christmas errand, grocery store, putting gas in the car. Made base for cream cheese/shrimp spread. Supper ready.
Okay, I'm out.
Alright. I'd better go take care of this errand. Oh look. It's down to 6F now. Lovely.
